title: Approved Through 6/2023
state_content:
CMS did not approve a number of SUD-related features requested by Illinois, including expenditure authority to:
develop and implement integrated physical and behavioral health homes (e.g., funding for provider training and
capacity building); implement BH workforce training and capacity-building initiatives (e.g., loan repayment,
incentives to work in underserved areas, telemedicine, etc.); provide select benefits for justice-involved
populations 30 days prior to release; and provide federal matching funds for BH-related DHSPs. Additionally, CMS
did not approve Illinois’s waiver requests to delay Medicaid redetermination for justice-involved populations until
180 days after release and auto-enroll justice-involved populations in a MMC plan prior to discharge.
^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD
name: Approved SUD

title: Approved Through 3/2021
description: State has approved SUD waiver(s) and pending SUD waiver request(s)
second_heading: Proposed Changes in Medicaid Redesign Team Demonstration Amendment
state_content:
As part of its May 2017 waiver amendment request, the state requested to transition its 1915(c) waivers serving children into its 1115 waiver. CMS denied this request, and the 1915(c) waivers will operate concurrently with the 1115 demonstration.

title: Approved Through 9/2024
state_content:
At this time, CMS did not approve or deny Michigan’s request to consolidate authority for its 1915(b) and 1915(c) waivers related to the delivery of BH and HCBS benefits into the 1115 demonstration. In addition, CMS did not approve or deny Michigan’s request for expenditure authority to implement alternative payment methodologies that promote physical and BH integration between PIHPs providing BH services and MMC plans providing physical health, acute care and pharmacy services.

^ = Only covered under demonstration
* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD
name: Approved SUD

title: Approved Through 12/2023
state_content:
In its waiver approval letter, CMS indicates that because it released an SMD letter permitting waivers of the IMD exclusion for individuals obtaining MH treatment shortly before the approval of this demonstration, it will “continue discussing with New Mexico the state’s request for flexibility for beneficiaries who require short-term BH crisis services…[and] if approved, CMS expects that additional flexibility in this area may be incorporated into the Centennial Care 2.0 demonstration in the future.”

title: Approved Through 12/2023
state_content:
CMS rejected Wisconsin’s request to require as a condition of eligibility that individuals complete an annual drug use screening. Wisconsin requested that individuals with a positive screening who did not indicate a willingness to enter SUD treatment be required to complete a drug test, and individuals with a positive drug test be required to complete SUD treatment. In addition, Wisconsin requested that failure to complete drug screening, a drug test, or SUD treatment result in disenrollment, and individuals be required to consent to drug treatment before re-enrolling. Individuals who indicated a willingness to obtain SUD treatment would not have been required to complete drug screening as a condition of eligibility.

Wisconsin is in the midst of transitioning to managed care a subset of enrollees eligible for Medicaid on the basis of receiving SSI.

^ = Only covered under demonstration

* = Eligible for match for individuals residing in an IMD
name: Approved SUD
